i had gotten a fairly large contract for

of case was doing so well when the

what i discovered is that captive
finance companies like if you have
ford motor company and there's ford
credit or toyota and toyota credit and
that sort of thing where they are you
know kind of financing their own
vehicles etc those businesses
are extremely good businesses
and normally
lending is not such a good business in

actually i don't invest in them anymore

captive finance arms are very different
and the reason they're different is so
if you think about you know like the
certified pre-owned lexus for example
right you know you go to a lexus dealer
and you know they've got the lexus cars
but they also have the certified
pre-owned so certified pre-owned is only
possible with lexus you can't have it

we've done all the you know checks and
inspections
and and it gives a halo the brand halo
so it it
it has similar halo to buying a new car

a lot of assurance that you're getting a

their cars
and let's say it's a three year or five
year or seven year finance deal
and let's say the borrower defaults you
know doesn't make his payments etc they
can repossess the car and when the car
comes back to them
they are in a very privileged position
versus a typical lender so if i'm just
like you know citibank or chase or
someone who made a loan and the borrower
defaults and the asset comes back to me
i have so many different assets i am
dealing with that i don't have a
particular expertise or competence in a
lexus you know lexus bmw mercedes they
all look the same to citibank there's no
difference for them right so when when
these cars come back to citibank for
example
and they're going to default et cetera
citibank will just you know send it to

it's a little bit different so when they
repossess the car they have the option

making it part of lexus pre-owned
bringing it back into their dealer
channels for sale and getting a good

with that asset
is very different than the ability of a
